result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rodney Curtis Bufford

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rodney Curtis Bufford appeared by video.  Attorney Taylor Haefele for Allison Marie Ritter appeared by video for Rodney Curtis Bufford.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel has discovery and requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Rodney Curtis Bufford appeared by video.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter appeared by video for Rodney Curtis Bufford.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Jonathan Steinberg - MPD Police Officer. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact/No Firearms Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J.R.B.

Defendant Rodney Curtis Bufford in court.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court for Rodney Curtis Bufford.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Defense counsel was recently retained and requests a preliminary hearing. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-2-2022

Defendant Rodney Curtis Bufford in court.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Rodney Curtis Bufford appeared by video means. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant not SPD eligible. Counsel not obtained. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered an oral no contact order with J.R.B.
State is to submit a written no contact order at the next court date.

Defendant Rodney Curtis Bufford in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Rodney Curtis Bufford in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
